H0.text: The Arabic term 'Al-jebr' (reunion of broken parts) is famously associated with. Mathematics

H1.text: The Arabic term 'Al-jebr' (reunion of broken parts) is famously associated with. Surgery

H2.text: The Arabic term 'Al-jebr' (reunion of broken parts) is famously associated with. Archaeology

H3.text: The Arabic term 'Al-jebr' (reunion of broken parts) is famously associated with. ALGEBRA

A4.text: The word algebra comes from the Arabic term al-jabr, which originally referred to the surgical treatment of bonesetting.

A5.text: In the 9th century, the term received a mathematical meaning when Persian mathematician Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi employed it to name a method for transforming equations and used it in the title of his treatise al-Kitāb al-Mukhtaṣar fī Ḥisāb al-Jabr wal-Muqābalah [The Compendious Book on Calculation by Completion and Balancing] which was translated into Latin as Liber Algebrae et Almucabola.

A6.text: The basic concepts of algebra dating back to the 15th century are featured in the commentary.

A7.text: The Science of Algebra and Balancing is discussed in the commentary.
